citation.article-title: Deoxyribonucleic acid homology and other comparisons among obligately thermophilic hydrocarbonoclastic bacteria, with a proposal of Thermoleophilum minutum sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Thermoleophilum minutum sp. nov.
Thermoleophilum minutum (mi.nu'tum, L. adj. minutum small, referring to cell size)
Thermoleophilum minutum is the second species designated in the genus Thermoleophilum; a description of this genus has been published previously (20).
The type strain is strain YS-4 (= ATCC 35265), which was isolated from a hot spring in Yellowstone National Park, Wyo.
Growth occurs between 45 and 70°C, with an optimum temperature of 60°C.
Growth occurs at pH values ranging from 6.0 to 7.0, with an optimum pH of 6.8.
Only n-alkanes from 13 to 20 carbons long can be utilized as sources of carbon and energy.
The guanine-plus-cytosine content of the DNA is 70.0 mol%.
An additional strain is strain PTA-1 (= ATCC 35268).
